intro: Gastrolobium tricuspidatum, commonly known as the three-lobed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Gastrolobium tricuspidatum is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to thrive in harsh environments.
